column4: hi. I want to mount old wubi ubuntu disk to real ubuntu installation. how to do it?
I'm in Natty too
so lot's errors
the wubi 'disk file' is mountable via the mount command with the loop option.
I tried but it's not mounted
you  have to mount the file by hand. to access its contents
mount /media/Murka Maxtor/ubuntu/disks/root.disk /home/mechanism/wubi -o loop
watch out for spaces in the path.
but this disk have spaces in name lol
quote the path.
segmentation error
thats interesting if mount is seg faulting...
be sure the dir exists.. and you may need to be doing it with 'sudo'
I'm as root: root@MechanisM:/home/mechanism# mount '/media/Murka Maxtor/ubuntu/disks/root.disk' /home/mechanism/wubi -o loop and dir wubi is exists
forum theread on the topic -> http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1037874
go to the ubuntu-tweak homepage. download its deb. is the normal way
theres a natty only version of Ubuntu-tweak :)
where?
at the homepage. i just grabbed it..   the blog listed the url i think
ubuntu-tweak_0.5.11-1~natty1_all.deb
its working fine here.. but im in #ubuntu+1 talking about it,.
tried to unlock some options but not see any popups with enter password to unlock.
fist thing ubuntu-tweak did here was ask to enable its PPA. :)
